roadway_dispersion
Class highway_link

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--roadway_dispersion.link
        |
        +--roadway_dispersion.highway_link
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class highway_link
extends link
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Overview
highway_link is a link type developed specifically to emulate the release characteristics of the GM sulfate dispersion experiment. In theory, this link type can be used to simulate any free-flowing roadway link such as a highway or major arterial roadway link. Internally, the highway_link represents the vehicular emissions eminating from a free flowing roadway as a three dimensional array of point sources. Conceptually, this approach emulates a volume source type rather that the typical line-source approach used by other roadway dispersion models. The highway_link class is a subclass of the abstract link class. The point source array simulates uniform emissions from a control volume extending 2.5 m above the road and 3 m to lateral of each traveled way. The point densities are optimized so that there are a greater number of points sources nearby receptors. The highway_point_spacing class is used to determine the location and the weighting of each point source.

Notes:
All units in metric (MKS) unless otherwise stated.

Version:
1.0 (October 2001)
Author:
Tony Held
See Also:
link, highway_point_spacing

Field Summary
private  double line_strength
          variable line_strength representing the line source strength of the highway link - units are assumed to be grams of pollutant per meter per second [(grams of pollutant) / (m-s)].
private  double traffic_flowrate
          The variable traffic_flowrate is the vehicle flowrate on the link in vehicles/second.
private  double vehicle_EF
          variable vehicle_EF is the single vehicle aggregate emission factor in (grams of pollutant)/(vehicle-m) note: that is per meter not mile!

Field Detail

line_strength

private double line_strength
variable line_strength representing the line source strength of the highway link - units are assumed to be grams of pollutant per meter per second [(grams of pollutant) / (m-s)].

traffic_flowrate

private double traffic_flowrate
The variable traffic_flowrate is the vehicle flowrate on the link in vehicles/second. Note: usually traffic flowrates are in vehicles per hour but they must be specified in vehicles per second so that everything stays metric.

vehicle_EF

private double vehicle_EF
variable vehicle_EF is the single vehicle aggregate emission factor in (grams of pollutant)/(vehicle-m) note: that is per meter not mile!
Constructor Detail

highway_link

private highway_link()
This is the default constructor and is only used in the cloning process.

highway_link

public highway_link(coordinate start_point,
                    coordinate end_point,
                    double link_width,
                    double line_strength)
Creates a new highway_link instance with a default name by specifying the geometry and line strength of a highway link.
Parameters:
start_point - a coordinate value representing the begining of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
end_point - a coordinate value representing the end of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
link_width - a double value representing the width of the traveled way
line_strength - a double value representing the line source strength of the highway link - units are assumed to be (grams) / (m-s)

highway_link

public highway_link(coordinate start_point,
                    coordinate end_point,
                    double link_width,
                    double line_strength,
                    java.lang.String link_name)
Creates a new highway_link instance of a given name by specifying the geometry and line strength of a highway link.
Parameters:
start_point - a coordinate value representing the begining of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
end_point - a coordinate value representing the end of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
link_width - a double value representing the width of the traveled way
line_strength - a double value representing the line source strength of the highway link - units are assumed to be (grams) / (m-s)
link_name - - name of the link

highway_link

public highway_link(coordinate start_point,
                    coordinate end_point,
                    double link_width,
                    double vehicle_EF,
                    double traffic_flowrate)
Creates a new highway_link instance with a default name by specifying the geometry, traffic flowrate,and the aggregate per-vehicle emission factor. The overall source strength of the link will be calculated from these values.
Parameters:
start_point - a coordinate value representing the begining of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
end_point - a coordinate value representing the end of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
link_width - a double value representing the width of the traveled way
vehicle_EF - a double value representing the single vehicle aggregate emission factor in (grams of pollutant)/(vehicle-m) note: that is per meter not mile!
traffic_flowrate - a double is the vehicle flowrate on the link in vehicles/second. Note: usually traffic flowrates are in vehicles per hour but they must be specified in vehicles per second so that everything stays metric.

highway_link

public highway_link(coordinate start_point,
                    coordinate end_point,
                    double link_width,
                    double vehicle_EF,
                    double traffic_flowrate,
                    java.lang.String link_name)
Creates a new highway_link instance with a default name by specifying the geometry, traffic flowrate,and the aggregate per-vehicle emission factor. The overall source strength of the link will be calculated from these values.
Parameters:
start_point - a coordinate value representing the begining of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
end_point - a coordinate value representing the end of the link (based on traffic flow direction).
link_width - a double value representing the width of the traveled way
vehicle_EF - a double value representing the single vehicle aggregate emission factor in (grams of pollutant)/(vehicle-m) note: that is per meter not mile!
traffic_flowrate - a double is the vehicle flowrate on the link in vehicles/second.
link_name - is the user assigned name for the link Note: usually traffic flowrates are in vehicles per hour but they must be specified in vehicles per second so that everything stays metric.
Method Detail

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
This method returns a clone of a called link object with a perfect copy of all the called object's physical characteristics. Certain members of the called link were intentially not copied to the cloned link to prevent confusion as to whether the link holds old or new information. The super-class link information that is not copied by this clone include the point array and concentration members. The highway_link members not copied are the cross, line, & vertical profiles.
Overrides:
clone in class link

create_point_array

public void create_point_array()
The create_point_array subroutine uses a highway_point_spacing object to determine the point source array location and emission factors that are used to represent the roadway link. The points sources are then stored in the base class member point_array.
Overrides:
create_point_array in class link
